Reversed.aiml intends to produce aiml categories from simple texts. <get name="br"/>#NewlineSay "NEW SOURCE (YOUR SOURCE)" or "NS (YOUR SOURCE)" to include your source in the answers. <get name="br"/>#NewlineTo include a link edit the category "SET SOURCE"#Comma then say it. <get name="br"/>#Newline"UNSET SOURCE" will remove the old source.<get name="br"/>#NewlineSay "USE PREDICATES" to include values of it#Comma he#Comma she and they#Comma when determined#Comma in the generated code. Say "NO PREDICATES" if you don't want to include these values. <get name="br"/>#NewlineSay "CREATE KEYWORDS CODE" to generate code that matches any input with a sentence subject or object inside. Say "STOP KEYWORDS CODE" if you want to generate usual ReversedAiml code. <get name="br"/>#NewlineSay "STOP RECURSION CODE" if you want to generate code with original sentence inside the template. Say "CREATE RECURSION CODE" to generate code with a recursion to the original sentence inside the template. <get name="br"/>#NewlineYou can set a different tree branch for the generated categories#Comma Say "SETTREEBRANCH (YOUR TREEBRANCH PREFIX)" or "SETKWTREEBRANCH (YOUR TREEBRANCH PREFIX)" for keywords' categories. "UNSET TREEBRANCH" or "UNSET KWTREEBRANCH" will remove the old treebranch prefix. <get name="br"/>#NewlineTo include a line break edit the category "SET BR"#Comma then say it. <get name="br"/>#Newline"UNSET BR" will remove the old line break.<get name="br"/>

<think>#Newline        <set name="source">Source: <star/></set>#Newline        <set name="it">it</set>#Newline        <set name="they">they</set>#Newline        <set name="she">she</set>#Newline        <set name="he">he</set>#Newline        <set name="speaker">we</set>#Newline      </think>
